com.iver.cit.gvsig.fmap.core.gt2.factory
Interface OptionalFactory

All Superinterfaces:
Factory
public interface OptionalFactory
extends Factory

A factory that may not be available in all configurations.

Such factories often need some resources to download separatly, like a big file or a database. Those resources may not be installed in all configurations. The isReady() method tells if this factory has found every resources it needs in order to run.

FactoryRegistry.getServiceProvider(java.lang.Class, javax.imageio.spi.ServiceRegistry.Filter, com.iver.cit.gvsig.fmap.core.gt2.factory.Hints) iterates over all registered factories. If an ordering is set, it is taken in account. If no suitable factory was found before the iterator reachs this optional factory, then FactoryRegistry invokes isReady(). If the later returns true, then this optional factory is processed like any other factories. Otherwise it is ignored.

Optional factories are useful when the preferred factory requires resources that are not guaranteed to be installed on the client machine (e.g. the EPSG database) and some fallback exists (e.g. an EPSG factory based on a WKT file).

Ignored factories are not deregistered; they will be queried again every time getServiceProvider(...) is invoked and the iterator reachs this optional factory. This means that if a resource was not available at startup time but become available later, it may be selected the next time getServiceProvider(...) is invoked. It will have no impact on previous results of getServiceProvider(...) however.

OptionalFactory is not designed for factories with intermittent state (i.e. return value of isReady() varying in an unpredictable way). While FactoryRegistry can provides some deterministic behavior when the isReady() return value become true as explained in the previous paragraphe, the converse (when the value was true and become false) is unsafe. This is because factories returned by previous calls to getServiceProvider(...) would stop to work in an unexpected way for clients.

Method Summary
 boolean isReady()

Methods inherited from interface com.iver.cit.gvsig.fmap.core.gt2.factory.Factory
getImplementationHints
 

Method Detail

isReady

boolean isReady()
Returns true if this factory is ready for use. An optional factory may returns false for now but returns true later. However, the converse is not recommended.
